page.title: 04BROMSGROVE COURT LEET
page.content: The Court Leet is held every year in Bromsgrove. Bromsgrove was given a charter by King John in 1199 to hold a fair on the 24th June every year. This fair has carried on for many years. But now it is not held on the 24th June but on the Saturday nearest to it. At first the town councillors walk through the town. The town crier calls the people of Bromsgrove to pay attention. The Court then checks the quality of the leather,the weight of the bread and the quality of the beer. Then the Court goes to open the fair.
